def_cn: 打开（门、窗、盖等）
def_en: If you open something such as a door, window, or lid, or if it opens, its position is changed so that it no longer covers a hole or gap.

def_cn: 将（瓶、盒等）开封；拆开（包裹、信封等）
def_en: If you open something such as a bottle, box, parcel, or envelope, you move, remove, or cut part of it so you can take out what is inside.

def_cn: 翻开；张开；展开
def_en: If you open something such as a book, an umbrella, or your hand, or if it opens, the different parts of it move away from each other so that the inside of it can be seen.

def_cn: 打开（计算机文件）
def_en: If you open a computer file, you give the computer an instruction to display it on the screen.

def_cn: （使)(眼睛）睁开
def_en: When you open your eyes or your eyes open, you move your eyelids upwards, for example when you wake up, so that you can see.

def_cn: 敞开（双臂）
def_en: If you open your arms, you stretch them wide apart in front of you, usually in order to put them round someone.

def_cn: （身前）无遮挡的；（姿势）端正的
def_en: If you stand or sit in an open way, the front of your body is fully exposed and you are not bending forward or at an angle to someone.

def_cn: 坦率的；诚恳的；不作伪的
def_en: If you describe a person or their character as open, you mean they are honest and do not want or try to hide anything or to deceive anyone.

def_cn: 公开的；不加掩饰的
def_en: If you describe a situation, attitude, or way of behaving as open, you mean it is not kept hidden or secret.

def_cn: 愿意接受（建议、观点等）的；虚怀若谷的
def_en: If you are open to suggestions or ideas, you are ready and willing to consider or accept them.

def_cn: 容易招致（滥用、批评等）的；易受（攻击）的
def_en: If you say that a system, person, or idea is open to something such as abuse or criticism, you mean they might receive abuse or criticism because of their qualities, effects, or actions.

def_cn: 悬而未决的；尚未决定的
def_en: If you say that a fact or question is open to debate, interpretation, or discussion, you mean that people are uncertain whether it is true, what it means, or what the answer is.

def_cn: 开放（被封的道路、边界等）；开通
def_en: If people open something such as a blocked road or a border, or if it opens, people can then pass along it or through it.

def_cn: 通向（更大的地方）
def_en: If a place opens into another, larger place, you can move from one directly into the other.

def_cn: 开阔的；空旷的
def_en: An open area is a large area that does not have many buildings or trees in it.

def_cn: 敞开的；无遮盖的；无围挡的
def_en: An open structure or object is not covered or enclosed.

def_cn: （伤口）外露的，裸露的，流血的
def_en: An open wound is one from which a liquid such as blood is coming.

def_cn: 把（衣服）解开；把…的拉链拉开
def_en: If you open your shirt or coat, you undo the buttons or pull down the zip.

def_cn: （使）开始营业；（使）开门
def_en: When a shop, office, or public building opens or is opened, its doors are unlocked and the public can go in.

def_cn: 为（大楼、工厂、公司等）举行揭幕典礼；开设；开办；开张
def_en: When a public building, factory, or company opens or when someone opens it, it starts operating for the first time.

def_cn: （使）（会议、会谈）开始；召开
def_en: If something such as a meeting or series of talks opens, or if someone opens it, it begins.

def_cn: （以…）开始
def_en: If an event such as a meeting or discussion opens with a particular activity or if a particular activity opens an event, that activity is the first thing that happens or is dealt with. You can also say that someone such as a speaker or singer opens by doing a particular thing.

def_cn: （股市）开盘，开市
def_en: On the stock exchange, the price at which currencies, shares, or commodities open is their value at the start of that day's trading.

def_cn: 上映；开演；开幕
def_en: When a film, play, or other public event opens, it begins to be shown, be performed, or take place for a limited period of time.

def_cn: （在银行等处）开立（账户）
def_en: If you open an account with a bank or a commercial organization, you begin to use their services.

def_cn: （机会、选择等）可利用的，可得到的
def_en: If an opportunity or choice is open to you, you are able to do a particular thing if you choose to.

def_cn: （使）（机会、可能性等）出现;（使）产生
def_en: To open opportunities or possibilities means the same as to open them up.

def_cn: 人人可以参加（或接受）的；开放的
def_en: You can use open to describe something that anyone is allowed to take part in or accept.

def_cn: （提议等）有效的；（职位等）空缺的，可申请的
def_en: See also:opening; If something such as an offer or job is open, it is available for someone to accept or apply for.

def_cn: 在露天；在户外；在野外
def_en: If you do something in the open, you do it out of doors rather than in a house or other building.

def_cn: 公开的；众人皆知的
def_en: If an attitude or situation is in the open or out in the open, people know about it and it is no longer kept secret.

def_cn: 大开的；敞开的；（眼睛）睁大的
def_en: If something is wide open, it is open to its full extent.

def_cn: （比赛、选举等）结果不确定的，胜负难定的
def_en: If you say that a competition, race, or election is wide open, you mean that anyone could win it, because there is no competitor who seems to be much better than the others.

with open arms→see: arm;  to open the door→see: door;  to keep your eyes open→see: eye;  with your eyes open→see: eye;  to open your eyes→see: eye;  to open fire→see: fire;  to open your heart→see: heart;  the heavens open→see: heaven;  an open mind→see: mind;  to open your mind→see: mind;  to keep your options open→see: option;
